content.raw:
strange, `/atlas/joint_states` show up at about 990Hz consistently, while `/atlas/atlas_state` shows up at exactly 1000Hz from command line testing:
~~~
$rostopic hz /atlas/joint_states
subscribed to [/atlas/joint_states]
average rate: 989.474
	min: 0.000s max: 0.020s std dev: 0.00369s window: 1035
average rate: 993.990
	min: 0.000s max: 0.020s std dev: 0.00367s window: 2151
average rate: 992.263
	min: 0.000s max: 0.021s std dev: 0.00367s window: 2566

$rostopic hz /atlas/atlas_state
subscribed to [/atlas/atlas_state]
average rate: 1000.000
	min: 0.000s max: 0.014s std dev: 0.00308s window: 1087
average rate: 1000.000
	min: 0.000s max: 0.014s std dev: 0.00307s window: 2193
average rate: 1000.000
	min: 0.000s max: 0.014s std dev: 0.00307s window: 3302
average rate: 1000.000
	min: 0.000s max: 0.014s std dev: 0.00307s window: 3794
~~~

while [both publishers](#!/osrf/drcsim/src/d2d13d2a62ebc3cf83f2235487862b874bde5a14/ros/atlas_msgs/AtlasPlugin.cpp?at=default#cl-2510) are called from the same place.
content.html:
strange, /atlas/joint_states show up at about 990Hz consistently, while /atlas/atlas_state shows up at exactly 1000Hz from command line testing:

$rostopic hz /atlas/joint_states
subscribed to [/atlas/joint_states]
average rate: 989.474
    min: 0.000s max: 0.020s std dev: 0.00369s window: 1035
average rate: 993.990
    min: 0.000s max: 0.020s std dev: 0.00367s window: 2151
average rate: 992.263
    min: 0.000s max: 0.021s std dev: 0.00367s window: 2566

$rostopic hz /atlas/atlas_state
subscribed to [/atlas/atlas_state]
average rate: 1000.000
    min: 0.000s max: 0.014s std dev: 0.00308s window: 1087
average rate: 1000.000
    min: 0.000s max: 0.014s std dev: 0.00307s window: 2193
average rate: 1000.000
    min: 0.000s max: 0.014s std dev: 0.00307s window: 3302
average rate: 1000.000
    min: 0.000s max: 0.014s std dev: 0.00307s window: 3794

while both publishers are called from the same place.
